content.text: We are committed to recruiting high-quality educators and staff through a rigorous process that prioritizes child protection (Safer Recruitment).

content.title: Key Requirements
items: Qualifications: Relevant degree and teaching certification (Akta IV/PPG for locals, QTS/PGCE for expats).
Experience: Proven track record in education, preferably with Cambridge curriculum experience.
Background Checks: Mandatory police checks (SKCK) and reference verification from previous employers.

content.text: New staff undergo a comprehensive induction program to familiarize them with school policies, culture, and expectations.

items: General Induction: HR policies, code of conduct, safeguarding training.
Academic Induction: Curriculum framework, assessment policy, EduNav training.
Mentoring: Assignment of a buddy or mentor for the first semester.

content.text: Regular performance reviews ensure continuous professional growth and accountability.

steps.title: Goal Setting
steps.desc: Start of year: Teacher sets SMART goals aligned with school priorities.

steps.title: Observation
steps.desc: Mid-year: Formal classroom observations and feedback sessions.

steps.title: Review
steps.desc: End of year: Formal review of achievements against goals and professional standards.

content.text: The school supports staff development through internal workshops, external training (e.g., Cambridge training), and peer learning communities.
All staff are expected to uphold high standards of professional and ethical behavior, serving as positive role models for students. Breaches of the code may result in disciplinary action.
